column4: Gonna say it again. How do I get the default /etc file for a program if I changed it.
why not try re-installing the app?
I tried... doesn't seem to want to write a new file.
are you sure you re-installed the correct program?  What's the etc file?
ircd-hybrid
have you looked at the source files from the maintainer's source?
danielw:I am not that far advanced
which version do you have?
The one in the repos.. 7.2.2.dsfg.1-3
whcih /etc/ file?
/etc/ircd-hybrid/ircd.conf ... When I reinstall, it just comes up with a blank file.
inface, the entire ircd-hybrid folder is empy.
empty, too
have you tried a complete removal and then a re-install?
the only removal I've tried is a simple apt-get remove
Not sure what to say, but there is some source files here... http://prdownloads.sourceforge.net/ircd-hybrid/ircd-hybrid-7.2.2.tgz
if you extract that there is ian etc folder
it has several examples
Alright, silly me... now I know about purging.
Ever had experience with configging an ircd?
nope!  Never had to do that before...
hah, alright hten bro. Thanks for your help =p
no problem.  Good luck
